metadata.synopsis: Dr. Josef Van Ee (George Zucco) runs a private mental institution where he and his son, Ward (Roland Varno), are keeping his daughter-in-law, Laura (Molly Lamont), against her will. Laura is convinced her husband is trying to scare her away from their marriage, while Ward assures her she needs the help he's offering. Things go from bad to worse when Van Ee's brother, the magician professor Leonide (Bela Lugosi), shows up with his dwarf partner, Indigo (Angelo Rossitto).

reviews: Claustrophobic, eccentric, and at times downright incoherent, this film is oddly compelling in a warped sort of way.
Keeping fang firmly in cheek, there's much to be savoured in this old dark house style mystery.
It's practically outsider art, made by an unusually incompetent outsider.
A pale affair, made tolerable by Bela Lugosi's droll one-liners.
Turns out to be more comic than gothic.
It is hard to believe -- even within the weird world of poverty row -- that this movie got this way by accident. It may just be that the film was meant to be an aburdist joke.
